docs.text: sometimes i find 19th century british costume dramas a little hard to relate to .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's not the time or the distance , it's the rules and conventions of a social class that deserves resentment rather than sympathy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yet somehow , the movies are all well made and i always get caught up in the story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the wings of the dove fits the pattern .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kate ( helena bonham carter ) and merton ( linus roache ) are in love .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: merton , a newspaper writer , would like to marry kate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but kate's " job " , if you will , is to be a member of the british upper class .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: her father lost all of her family's money , but a wealthy aunt agreed to take care of her until she married a nice rich man .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: naturally , a newspaper writer's wages don't count as " rich . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kate leads him on , but she always ends up giving him the cold shoulder , ultimately because he's not marriageable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kate's american friend millie ( alison elliot ) stops in for a visit on her way to venice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at a party , millie catches a glimpse of merton and likes what she sees .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kate realizes that if merton were introduced to millie , he might forget about her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it appears that she is trying to spare him from the heartbreak of their inevitable breakup .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: merton sees what kate is doing and resents her for it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is still in love with kate , and will accept no substitute .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the three of them , along with a fourth friend ( elizabeth mcgovern ) end up on holiday in venice together , where their interactions are quite complicated .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: let's sum up : millie has fallen for merton .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: merton has no feelings for millie because he is still in love with kate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kate loves him but can't marry him , so on the one hand she's trying to match him up with someone who will make him happy , but on the other hand she's jealous of them as a couple .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a clear solution presents itself to kate when she realizes that millie is very sick - dying , in fact .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at this point she decides that merton should marry millie until she dies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: millie will leave her money to merton , who will then be rich enough to marry kate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she lets merton know of her schemes and , since it will help him win kate , he reluctantly agrees .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kate leaves venice so that the two m's can be alone together .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: merton finds that pretending to love millie is a lot like actually loving her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's not sure he can separate the two .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kate finds that she's not so sure she really wants her merton falling in love with and marrying anyone else .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the brilliant scheme proves to be painful to all involved .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: without revealing the details , suffice it to say that the situation ends badly .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the title refers to the object of merton's vain hope that something might lift him from his predicament .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one is left with feelings of regret and despair .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what started as such a promising relationship was damaged by greed , anger , and jealousy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: an interesting thought struck me after the movie was over , and that is that the wings of the dove almost fits the story line of a film noir .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a couple conspires to cheat someone out of their money so they can live happily ever after .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: their involvement in the deception makes each less attractive to the other , and after a few things go wrong , the whole idea seems like an awful life-ruining mistake .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i wouldn't call the wings of the dove a film noir , but the comparison is interesting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as i have acknowledged before , i am not a wonderful judge of acting , but i liked the performances from roache and elliot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: roache successfully conveyed his character's ambivalence toward millie : near the end , he hugs her , at first staring into space , as if he's thinking about his plan with kate , then giving that up to fully embrace millie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: millie's part didn't require as much range , but elliot gave her the necessary bubbly personality that made her irresistible .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i will probably file away the wings of the dove in the same low-traffic corner of my mind as sense and sensibility and persuasion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: their settings are far removed from my personal experience - geographically , historically , and socially .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: still , the movies are well made and the stories inevitably win me over .
docs.label: positive
